DataElement.preferredName: Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale 9 Last 2 Weeks Level of Sexual Desire or Interest Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation in the last two weeks describing their sexual interest / drive, using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale Past 2 Weeks Level of Sexual Desire or Interest Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 10-item self-report questionnaire that measures quality of life for men with prostate cancer._A period of time consisting of the 14 days before the present._A question about an individual's level or degree of sexual desire or interest._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A 10-item self-report questionnaire that measures quality of life for men with prostate cancer.

Concepts.definition: A 10-item self-report questionnaire that measures quality of life for men with prostate cancer.

Property.preferredName: Past 2 Weeks Level of Sexual Desire or Interest Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A period of time consisting of the 14 days before the present.:A question about an individual's level or degree of sexual desire or interest.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A period of time consisting of the 14 days before the present.

Concepts.longName: Level of Sexual Desire or Interest
Concepts.definition: A question about an individual's level or degree of sexual desire or interest.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale Sex Drive 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Normal Amount of Sexual Drive and Interest

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Normal Amount of Sexual Drive and Interest
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had their normal amount of sexual drive and interest.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had their normal amount of sexual drive and interest.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had a little decrease of sexual drive or interest.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had a little decrease of sexual drive or interest.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had a moderate decrease of sexual drive or interest.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had a moderate decrease of sexual drive or interest.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Substantial Decrease of Sexual Drive or Interest

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had a substantial decrease of sexual drive or interest.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had a substantial decrease of sexual drive or interest.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Please choose the statement t
ReferenceDocuments.description: Please choose the statement that comes closest to describing your sexual interest/drive in the last two weeks.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

DataElement.origin: PORPUS:Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale, Krahn M, Ritvo P, Irvine J, et al., J Clin Epidemiol 2000
